column4: what you intend with alias? i changed DocmentRoot because i moved my www folder to dropbox
when installing phpmyadmin, it should create a /etc/apache2/conf.d/phpmyadmin.conf file
in your apache2.conf should be an include line to include all these files in apache2/conf.d
did you install the software from the ubuntu repositories?
very strange that the other link was not created. It should have been created at install. You can create it:   sudo ln -s /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf /etc/apache2/conf.d/phpmyadmin.conf
also, when you run this:   grep -i include /etc/apache2/apache2.conf |grep -v ^#     several lines should show, and 1 should be  Include conf.d/
I think you have to restart the apache2 server:  sudo service apache2 restart
test it? And keep an eye on the logs in /var/log/apache2
now i got this message: Wrong permissions on configuration file, should not be world writable!
well, something messed up your installation. I'm not sure which configuration file? What is the permissions on /etc/phpmyadmin/apache2.conf? Should be 644
that is not a clever thing to do
yes, but several linux programs check that the security/permissions is not set too open.
linux has lots of security systems build in. Don't mess with that, such workaround always end in error
there are *many* configurationfiles. Some have 644, some have other permissions
